statement: I don't really know what I'm good at.
I've done a lot of things, but I can't explain what skills I've actually gained.
I'm not sure what I actually care about when it comes to a career.
People say I'm good at things, but I don't really see it myself.
I know what sounds good, but I don't know what actually matters to me.
I keep making decisions based on what others expect, not what I want.
I feel drained by my current classes or activities, but I don't know why.
I'm just going through the motions — nothing feels exciting anymore.
I can't tell the difference between what I like and what I'm just used to doing.
I feel like there are only a few 'real' career paths, and none of them fit me.
I have no idea what jobs even exist for someone like me.
I need more options — I feel stuck thinking about the same few ideas.
I have too many ideas and feel paralyzed trying to choose.
I keep going back and forth between options and can't commit.
I don't know how to weigh things like money, location, and lifestyle.
I know what I want to do, but I don't know how to get started.
I'm afraid I'll pick the wrong thing and waste time.
I don't feel ready to make any career decisions yet.
